item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#893)—Clues and Answers for Thursday, November 20
item.content:encoded:
The weekend is almost here, but before it comes, you need to smash a couple more NYT Connections puzzles! Fortunately, I’m on hand (as always) to bring you the best NYT Connections hints and solutions that you need to ace today’s challenge. If you’re stuck on today’s NYT Connections puzzle, this is the guide that you need.

Read on to secure the tips and answers that you need to keep that streak going.

What is NYT Connections?

It would be remiss of me not to give a little foundational backstory before leaping into today’s NYT Connections clues and hints.

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

Playing NYT Connections on your commute or while waiting for a coffee is a fantastic way to kill a few minutes.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

It’s relatively simple, and that’s why it’s the best New York Times game, in my opinion.

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (November 20)

If you want to figure out today’s NYT Connections clues without getting the answers outright, I’ll start with the words themselves. Perhaps just seeing the words here will spur your brain into action, and you’ll spot the trends immediately.

Here are the NYT Connections words from today’s puzzle, #893:

  • ARTY
  • KISS
  • ENAMEL
  • ESSAY
  • CROWN
  • DECAY
  • BRUSH
  • PASTE
  • ANY
  • SKIM
  • PLASTER
  • PULP
  • STICK
  • STROKE
  • ROOT
  • FIX

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Think of things you’d literally apply to bond surfaces; one is more “medical wall stuff” than “craft glue.
  • Green – These are words for a light touch; one of them can be romantic or just feather-light.
  • Blue – Mix inner anatomy and outer protection; two are internal tissues, two are what you see or what caps it.
  • Purple – Say them out loud. One hides a “decay” pun that echoes D-K, and another rhymes its way to S-A.

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, November 20.

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers for Today, November 20 (#893)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – FIX, PASTE, PLASTER, STICK
  • Green – BRUSH, KISS, SKIM, STROKE
  • Blue – CROWN, ENAMEL, PULP, ROOT
  • Purple – ANY, ARTY, DECAY, ESSAY

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

item.title: Call of Duty DMZ is Coming Back Soon, But There’s a Catch
item.content:encoded:
It has been revealed that Call of Duty’s DMZ mode is returning in December, but there’s a huge catch. The once-popular extraction shooter platform first emerged in Modern Warfare II in 2022, but after a few months of updates, it eventually disappeared from the ecosystem, never to return – until now.

There’s a huge catch though.

DMZ: Recon Coming December 11th

DMZ: Recon is a new extraction shooter experience coming to Call of Duty: Mobile in December. It’s a reflection of the DMZ title that was released alongside Modern Warfare II in 2022, albeit a ‘shrunk-down’ version.

It will land during COD Mobile’s Season 11 update, and like the original, it’s set to feature PvPvE gameplay. Unlike the original DMZ, it’s expected that there will be no punishment or negativity surrounding PvP, as that was a sticking point for fans of the first platform. This is reflected in there being no ‘team recruitment’ mechanics, which were in the first DMZ.

Early impressions from COD Mobile leakers suggested that DMZ: Recon will be entirely first-person and will feature an in-match buy store, just like the one found in the original DMZ mode. There will be boss characters, weapons can be levelled up in flight, and loot is based on a tier system that includes extremely rare collectibles.

Players can reportedly purchase vehicles on the fly, and as it’s a smaller experience, only eight teams of three will occupy each match.

It has also been suggested that two maps will emerge at launch on December 11th: Serpent Island and Building 21. It was also claimed from those attending preview events that players arrive in the game via a wingsuit, can use killstreaks, carry three weapons, and can extract using a helicopter system, just like the first game.

Are you happy to see DMZ coming back, even if it’s only in COD Mobile? Let your thoughts be known via the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Avalanche Studios has closed an office in the UK

item.title: Avalanche Studios Officially Closes Liverpool Office
item.content:encoded:
Nearly two months after announcing the plans, Avalanche Studios has officially closed its office in Liverpool. This closure sees 31 people lose their jobs, adding to the ever-growing job loss count in the gaming industry.

In a post on its website, the company confirmed the closure and thanked the staff who were impacted.

“The exceptional talent, passion, and commitment from everyone leaving have impacted every project,” the statement reads. “We are truly grateful for the dedication and invaluable contributions to Avalanche Studios Group.

“Our focus remains on supporting the [staff] through this transition and to carry on making great games for our player communities.“

Layoffs Months In The Making

Plans of the Liverpool closure was first announced in September. They came just weeks after it was revealed that development on Contraband was ending. Avalanche said the decision came after an internal review of the company and its plans moving forward after the game’s cancelation.

“This review has led us to the difficult conclusion that we must make changes to our staffing and locations,” they said at the time, while saying it would impact all employees in Liverpool.

In addition to the Liverpool office, layoffs were planned for offices in Malmö and Stockholm. There hasn’t been an update on those locations, however.

Insider Gaming has reached out to Avalanche Studios for what the plans for the studio are moving forward. Should a response be received, it will be added to this story.

How do you feel about the continued layoffs throughout the gaming industry, at Avalanche and elsewhere? Leave your thoughts down in the comments below and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read about Dispatch’s latest sales milestone. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Dispatch Reaches Two Million Copies in Less Than A Month
item.content:encoded:
Despite releasing less than a month ago, AdHoc’s Dispatch has sold two million copies. The last episodes, 7 and 8, only came out last week and reached a million copy milestone within 10 days.

Released in late October, Dispatch follows Robert, a former superhero working a desk job and dispatching ‘reformed’ villains in Los Angeles. Composed of former TellTale Games members, AdHoc Studios brought the iconic Choose-Your-Own-Adventure-type dialogue choices and consequences. The game quickly became the best-selling title on Steam with only two episodes. Then, it reached a million copies only a week and a half after release. Now, with all the episodes out, the team shared an even bigger milestone.

AdHoc Studios Celebrates Two Million Copies Sold for Dispatch With New Drawing

A new post from AdHoc Studios reveals that Dispatch has sold two million copies, a huge milestone for an indie title. To commemorate the occasion, Derek Stratton, the game’s art director, drew a new picture featuring everyone’s favorite character, Beef. The drawing is somber, as no new episodes have been released due to Episode 7 and 8 being the last ones. Still, the team seems pretty grateful for the many fans who joined in the journey.

Currently, Dispatch is available on PC and PlayStation 5. No ports to Xbox Series X|S or Nintendo Switch 2 have been announced. Unfortunately, no Season Two has been revealed yet, though the team seems adamant about bringing it back. Given how it started development years ago, it’ll likely be some time before we see the Z-Team again. Still, with how popular it has become (and earning a Game Award nomination), the future for the title is looking bright.

What do you think about Dispatch’s impressive sales? Did you play the game? Worth the hype? Favorite episode? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Dispatch, check out our preview of the game, as well as an interview with AdHoc Studios itself. Don’t forget to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!
